habitat_description:
This species was recently elevated from a subspecies of S. magister (Crothers et al 2008)
In Arizona, it occurs in the Lower Colorado River Desertscrub into Great Basin Conifer Woodland (Brennan and Holycross 2009). The range includes Arizona, New Mexico and West Texas (Degenhardt et al. 1996; Dixon 2000). This species occupies the Sonoran deserts of Arizona. In New Mexico, this species has been reported from the  Cienega San Simon and Granite Gap in the Peloncillo Mountains, Hidalgo County, and in the Pecos River valley. In Mexico, this lizard can be found as far as Sinaloa, Coahuila, and northeastern Durango. 

Mesquite-yucca grassland, mesquite and juniper woodland, edges of arroyos and playas, cottonwood and willow zones. Arid to semi arid habitat, shrubland, conifer and grassland-woodland. Riparian habitat in Arizona and New Mexico.  Also, creosote bush, velvet mesquite, burro bush, greasewood, cacti, sagebrushes, saltbushes, junipers, and grasses. In riparian areas, arrow weed, tamarisk, Fremont cottonwood, palms, and willows (Jones and Lovich 2009).
